oai_dc:dc.dc:title: C.C.C. workers from Co. 1473 splitting logs at Camp Evan Shelby
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pickens, James H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For current rights information, please visit: http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200600000001200
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two Civilian Conservation Corps workers, from Co. 1473, one smoking a cigarette, work with small axes splitting wood at Camp Evan Shelby in Bristol, Tennessee in 1933. this photograph was donated by James H. Pickens.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.) -- People -- 1930-1940
Fuelwood cutting.
Tennessee Valley Authority and "grass roots democracy" .
